subject: History
title: Al-Khwarizmi Invents Algebra
description: Learn Al-Khwarizmi Invents Algebra in one minute.

hook.text: The word 'algebra' comes from a 9th-century book by a Muslim scholar. So does the word 'algorithm'‚Äîfrom his name.

buildup.text: Muhammad ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi worked at the House of Wisdom in Baghdad around 820 AD.

discovery.text: His book Al-Jabr introduced systematic methods for solving equations‚Äîmoving terms across the equals sign.

twist.text: He didn't use symbols or x's. Everything was written in words. Yet his methods work identically to modern algebra.

climax.text: Al-Khwarizmi also introduced Hindu-Arabic numerals to the Islamic world. Europe adopted them centuries later.

punchline.text: Every student who solves for x owes a Baghdad scholar.
